Uses of Class
smile.taxonomy.Concept

  • Packages that use Concept 
    Package Description
    smile.taxonomy
    A taxonomy is a tree of terms (concepts) where leaves must be named but intermediary nodes can be anonymous.

    • Uses of Concept in smile.taxonomy

      Methods in smile.taxonomy that return Concept 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Concept Concept.addChild(java.lang.String concept)
      Add a child to this node
      Concept Taxonomy.getConcept(java.lang.String keyword)
      Returns a concept node which synset contains the keyword.
      Concept Taxonomy.getRoot()
      Returns the root node of taxonomy tree.
      Concept Taxonomy.lowestCommonAncestor(Concept v, Concept w)
      Returns the lowest common ancestor (LCA) of concepts v and w.
      Concept Taxonomy.lowestCommonAncestor(java.lang.String v, java.lang.String w)
      Returns the lowest common ancestor (LCA) of concepts v and w.
      Methods in smile.taxonomy that return types with arguments of type Concept 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.List<Concept> Concept.getChildren()
      Get all children concepts.

      Returns the path from root to the given node.
      java.util.List<Concept> Concept.getPathToRoot()
      Returns the path from the given node to the root.
